title: Student finance applications: full-time study, England

department.title: Department for Business, Innovation and Skills

description: Student finance provides students living in England with the funding they require for full-time higher education.
description-extra: The Student Loans Company also ensures students receive their payments, maintain their account and make repayments. The service varies across the devolved administrations: customers in England receive the full service from SLC; in Wales and Northern Ireland the service is delivered with the support of local authority partners; in Scotland it is delivered in partnership with SAAS.

modules.title: Transactions per year
info: Data source: Department for Business, Innovation and Skills

modules.title: Total cost
info: The total cost for all aspects of processing a student finance application including: mail handling, staff processing time, customer advice, subsequent payment (up to 9 per applicant per annum), identity assurance, data sharing with higher education institutions and UCAS. The transactional costs quoted are approximate and subject to refinement.
Data source: Department for Business, Innovation and Skills

Total cost is the overall cost per year of providing a service, including staff, IT and accommodation costs; the total cost is automatically calculated from volume and cost per transaction figures, and some rounding errors may occur.

modules.title: Cost per transaction
info: The total cost for all aspects of processing a student finance application including: mail handling, staff processing time, customer advice, subsequent payment (up to 9 per applicant per annum), identity assurance, data sharing with higher education institutions and UCAS. The transactional costs quoted are approximate and subject to refinement.
Data source: Department for Business, Innovation and Skills
Cost per transaction is the average cost of providing each successfully completed transaction, across all channels. Staff, IT and accommodation costs should be included.

modules.title: Applications started and submitted
modules.description: Applications for the current and previous academic year
info: Data source: Student Loans Company

Digital applications are counted as ‘started’ when the applicant creates an application for student finance. They are counted as ‘submitted’ when they complete and submit the application. This data includes automated applications counted as started and submitted on the same day, these are submitted on behalf of non means tested students expected to re-apply for student finance. Automated applications are created over a two week period in the early part of each new business cycle i.e. the academic year of intended study.

Any paper applications received are data entered into the system by SLC staff. Paper applications are counted as ‘started’ and ‘submitted’ when the processing team starts the data entry of the application.

modules.title: Applications breakdown
modules.description: Submitted digital and paper form applications for 2014/15
info: Data source: Student Loans Company
Shows the number of new Student Finance England full-time higher education applications submitted for the 2014/15 academic year, broken down by channel

modules.title: Digital take-up
modules.description: Proportion of applications made using the digital service
info: Data source: Student Loans Company
Digital take-up measures the percentage of submitted applications that are made through a digital channel versus non-digital channels

modules.title: User satisfaction
modules.description: Overall satisfaction score includes all ratings weighted from 100% for 'very satisfied' to 0% for 'very dissatisfied'
info: Data source: Student Loans Company
User satisfaction is measured by surveying users at the point of transaction completion.

modules.title: Users at each stage
modules.description: Number of digital channel users who started key stages of the transaction last week
info: Data source: Google Analytics
The total number of users who arrived at each stage of the application process
Number of users is measured using the count of unique events from each step

modules.title: Site traffic
modules.description: Total number of unique site visits per week
info: Data source: Google Analytics
This show the total number of visitors to the service each week.
Visitors may be accessing the site through multiple devices or have deleted cookies, so may be counted more than once.
These metrics may be based on sampled data.

modules.title: Service availability
info: Data source: Pingdom
Page load time measures the time taken for a sample page within the service to load.
Uptime measures the percentage of time that the service was observed to be available.
